commit.message:
Draft: Correctly positioning channel in case of exception

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Corrected try-catch block

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Moving I/O ops into the for statement block

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Replaced custom bounds check by Objects.checkFromIndexSize()

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Replaced casting by pattern matching for instanceof

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Replacing var by actual type

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Hiding ChannelOutputStream from the API

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Removing final everywhere but kept only for constants

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Using Thread-Local Buffer Cache

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Increased DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE

These days I/O devides, particularly SSDs, are much faster than in the
days this original code was written. Due to that, the transfer time is
less I/O bound. Performance can be increased significantly by spending
16x 8 KiB instead of the original 1x 8 KiB heap memory (approx. doubles
performance, clearly depending on the used hardware).

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>

Draft: Offloading transfer to deeper layers

Preventing transfer through the JVM heap by using NIO and potentially
performing intra-OS transport to improve performance where possible.

Signed-off-by: Markus Karg <markus@headcrashing.eu>
